runs.comm: pitched up and swings away outside off, Chandimal strides forward and pushes towards cover point
Naveed brings this one back in on a length, Chandimal comes forward and taps it defensively towards mid-on
this does not swing. Back of a length and slides in with the angle from over the wicket, dabbed towards midwicket with soft hands
shorter and angled in on off, jabbed down the pitch off the inside half of the bat
rushing short ball, tucks Dilshan up for room. He shapes to pull and ends up flapping it towards square leg. The extra bounce put Dilshan off
Naveed generates extra bounce again! Short and on off, this one rears up as well. The ball hits the bat as opposed to the bat hitting ball. Fended feebly in front of point
back of a length on off, forward-defensive push to cover
sprayed into the hips, fine leg is inside the circle. This is easily flicked away past him
back of a length and just a shade outside off, patted to cover again
even shorter on a similar line, Chandimal stands tall and punches solidly to mid-off
Dilshan shuffles across off and secures a single through midwicket with a whirl of the wrists. This was bowled on a length and outside off
short and some width outside off, Chandimal wants to slash it away. He can beat the packed off-side field
banged in short and outside off, this isn't too quick to threaten Dilshan. He skips back and pulls it to the long leg boundary
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off with extra bounce. Dilshan throws his hands at it. Beaten
and again! Dilshan has a leaden-footed whoosh and is beaten outside off
dug in short and outside off, Dilshan connects this. He swipes it over mid-on

Naveed retorts with a rising, short ball at 137.7ks. Dilshan is on his tippy toes as he awkwardly fends it onto the pitch. Dilshan strode forward and was pinged on the glove. He gets some attention from the physio
full and angles in, Dilshan whips his wrists and forces it between midwicket and mid-on
full and swerves in, jammed back to the bowler off an inside edge
Chandimal feigns to dance out, this is banged short and outside off. Chandimal goes for a dirty swish. He can't connect
much better from Chandi. He rides the bounce of this short ball around off, dabbing it behind point
back of a length and outside off, slogged through backward square leg off an inside edge
banged in short, Chandimal gets on top of the bounce and pulls it powerfully over midwicket
length ball on off, heaved past mid-on. Dragged away for four. SL's openers are flexing their muscles
full and drifting into the pads, flicked squarer of short fine leg
back of a length and outside off, Dilshan punches straight to mid-off
back of a length on off, Dilshan manipulates it to short midwicket with the wrists
full and width outside off, slower ball at 116ks, Chandi spots it and forces it past the diving cover fielder
too full and straight, Chandimal whips it away.... The man at short midwicket dives to his left, puts in a lazy effort, and gives a four
pitched up and swings away outside off, beating the outside edge
short ball on off, hurries onto the batsman. Played to mid-on
short ball on off, Chandi leans back, rides the bounce, and helps it down to third man
back of a length and outside off, Dilshan gets on top of the bounce. Jabbing punch to the covers
back of a length on off, chopped to point
change of pace, slower ball outside off, Chandi goes low for a slog-sweep. He does not connect
shot! Length ball on off, Chandi eases forward and creams a drive past the covers; SL rattling along
tossed up and drifts in, Dilshan pokes it towards cover
even loopier on middle, defended back to the bowler on the front foot
Raza shortens his length on middle and leg, turned to square leg for one
a big appeal for lbw, it is nipped in the bud. Arm ball, snakes in to catch the pad, but this was going down leg
flighted around off, dabbed towards point
dances out to meet a half-volley and whip through midwicket
sloppy work from short fine leg. Sloppy ball as well. Sliding into the pads, glanced away. The short fine leg fielder does not get his body behind it. He puts an ill-timed dive, and gifts a four
short and outside off, Chandi looks to cut and sends a top edge to third man
length and outside off, guided down to third man
length ball on middle, Dilshan shuffles across off, misses the scoop, and is socked on the helmet
back of a length and outside off, muscled over midwicket. Agricultural swipe
length and outside off, Dilshan goes low for a sweep and deflects it onto his pad off an inside snick
tossed up on leg, Dilshan reverse sweeps and misses. He is hit on the pad
knocked through midwicket
down the track and flicked through midwicket
slides on, reverse sweep and a miss
darted outside off, steered to point
veering into the pads, clipped through midwicket on the back foot
and he breaks the strong opening stand! Short ball just a shade outside off, Dilshan shapes to pull. He fetches it from there and mis-hits it to deep midwicket. Dilshan never really found his rhythm
back of a length and comes in, squirted to the leg side off an insid edge
length and outside off, Siri slices it down to third man
Amjad generates extra bounce outside off and beats Chandimal on the late cut
nails a yorker at the base of middle, squeezed to cover
picked away off the pads to long leg
tossed up, milked to long-on
darted on off from round the wicket, down the track and flicked to long-on
Siri dances out, this is darted down leg, deflected behind square. Leg bye, first extras in the innings
clipped to square leg
flat and fired on middle, whipped to cow corner
width outside off, Siri carves it over the covers

Siri has been bounced out too. Dug in short and cramping Siri for room. He looks to pull and miscues it to deep midwicket, the fielder moves to his right to snap it up. Two in two overs for Amjad. Can UAE build on this?
short on off, chopped to third man
back of a length on off, dropped towards midwicket for one
short on off, camps back and turns a single to midwicket
Amjad loses his radar and pushes this down leg, wide

back of a length on middle, the batsman targets the leg side with a flick, ends up poking to cover off a leading edge. They hare across for the second. Shanaka dives but the fielder failed to effect a direct hit
juicy full toss on off, this should have been dispatched. Instead, Chandi bends his knee and pushes to cover
floated up and drifts in, defended to the leg side
length ball on off, pushed back
flighted on middle, turned to midwicket
sliding down leg, wide
Shanaka steps outside leg, the bowler follows him with a quick fizzer. Slapped down to long-on
tossed up on off, reverse swept to backward point
picked away off the pads to deep midwicket
pitched up on off, swatted to long-on. Chandi comes back for the second and raises his fifty
fifty and out! Back of a length and outside off, Chandimal takes it from there and slogs it into the lap of midwicket. Chandi hit that hard but placement deserted him... Target practice
good length and comes in to hit Mathews' pad outside the line of off. Amjad pleads for lbw, but the umpire does not budge
beauty! Sharp inducker, slices Mathews into half, beats the inside edge and climbs over the stumps
Mathews charges down the track, the bowler is wary of it as he shortens his length outside off. Carved over backward point

Shanaka wants a single, he sets off, and is almost halfway down the pitch. He has to turn back as Mathews isn't interested. Brief mix-up, but no harm done for SL. Back of a length on off, front-foot punch to the midwicket region. The fielder did swoop down on the ball, but did not throw the stumps down
tossed up on the pads, worked to square leg
flighted and drifts in, turned through midwicket
tossed up and angled in, down the track and dragged through midwicket off the inside half
shorter on off, stands tall and punches to cover
flat and fired on middle, Mathews goes low and sweeps it firmly behind square
Shanaka jumps outside leg to make swinging room. The bowler chases him, slashed past the covers
full on off, dragged to short midwicket
Shanaka picks out mid-off. His slow struggle is over. Length ball on off, he moves outside leg and slaps it to Anwar. SL slump further
short and wide outside off, flayed to the left of backward point, not quite like Sanath
back of a length and angled in, Mathews camps back and secures a single through backward square leg
Jayasuriya dances out, this is darted wide outside off. Swing and a miss. It was inside the tramline. Why was that wided?
short, hits the deck and cuts away outside off, beating the outside edge with extra bounce and movement
short and angled away outside off, Jayasuriya rides the bounce and glides it past backward point. Neatly done; first boundary since the 8th over
Sri Lanka five down, Rohan wheels away in celebration. Non-turning ball, fired in, Mathews can't connect with an ambitious reverse sweep. He is hit on the pad in front of the leg stump
nudged behind square on the leg side
drilled back to the bowler
quick fizzer on the pads, deflected to midwicket. The pair take off for a single. He slides his bat in, despite a direct hit from Rohan
blockhole ball on middle, slapped back to the bowler
slides on middle from round the wicket, spanked to long-off
short and outside off, cut down to third man
good length ball on middle, Jayasuriya shuffles across off and laps this slower ball over short fine leg. A fan does the gangnam in the stands
Jayasuriya aims for an encore and fails. A touch fuller on middle, he shuffles across for a lap-scoop again. He misses. Naveed knocks the middle stump back. SL losing wickets in a heap
short and outside off, cracked to backward point
short and outside off, dragged to long-on off the inside half
back of a length on off, guided towards point
yorker on leg, squeezed back
the batsman makes room by backing away outside leg. Rohan spears another yorker on middle, dug out to long-on
darted down leg, wide
length ball on off, muscled to long-on
down the track and drilled to long-off
Naveed shells a skier at short fine leg. Flat and quick, Kapu loads up for a slog and top-edges it... The ball pops in and pops out
Kapu backs away and swipes a flat ball to long-on

Shahzad has a sheepish little smile on his face. Off-stump full toss, heaved straight to deep midwicket. That should have been heaved over him; it was the shorter part of the ground as well. It has been that kind of a day for SL. Replays confirm the full toss was below the waistline and Kapu has to go
slower ball, floated outside off. Left alone
Shahzad aims a yorker, pushes it too full on off, drilled to long-off
yorker on middle, hit to long-on
pitched up and room outside off, Kula throws his hands at it, scything it over backward point
and the innings ends with a wicket. Slower bouncer outside off, Kula wants to swipe over midwicket. He can't get on top of the bounce. He skies a top edge, this is caught by the keeper
